data.q: Which statement is used to execute code when a condition is true?
data.e: `if` executes a block of code only when the specified condition evaluates to true.

data.q: Which loop is guaranteed to run at least once?
data.e: `do...while` executes the loop body once before checking the condition.

data.q: What keyword is used to exit a loop prematurely?
data.e: `break` immediately exits the nearest enclosing loop or switch statement.

data.q: Which keyword skips the current iteration of a loop and moves to the next one?
data.e: `continue` skips the remaining code in the current iteration and proceeds with the next iteration.

data.q: Which statement is best suited for handling multiple discrete values of a variable?
data.e: `switch` is useful when comparing a single value against multiple possible cases.

data.q: What happens if a `break` statement is omitted inside a `switch` case?
o: Execution falls through to the next case
data.e: Without `break`, execution continues into the next case (fall-through behavior).

data.q: Which loop is commonly used to iterate over object properties?
data.e: `for...in` iterates over enumerable property names of an object.

data.q: Which loop is best suited for iterating over iterable values like arrays?
data.e: `for...of` iterates directly over the values of an iterable.

data.q: What does the conditional (ternary) operator return?
o: One of two expressions based on a condition
data.e: The ternary operator returns one of two expressions depending on whether the condition is true or false.

data.q: Which keyword is used to stop further execution inside a function?
data.e: `return` exits the function and optionally returns a value.
